desc: Directed by Enzo Trapani.  With Ermanno Randi, Lois Maxwell, Amedeo Nazzari, Juan de Landa. A police inspector teams with an ex serviceman in order to break a ring of drug pushers after WW2. The veteran has had his sister killed by the drug traffickers and he himself is in serious danger.

primaryTitle: El negro que tenía el alma blanca
originalTitle: El negro que tenía el alma blanca
desc: Directed by Hugo del Carril.  With Hugo del Carril, María Rosa Salgado, Antonio Casal, Félix Fernández.
Directed by Alfred Braun.  With Käthe Gold, René Deltgen, Paul Wegener, Hans Schlenck.

Directed by Camillo Mastrocinque.  With Massimo Girotti, Annette Bach, Roldano Lupi, Constance Dowling. Bianca, a rich heiress, being an orphan, lives in her palace with her guardian uncle and cousin Olga.
Directed by Giuseppe Maria Scotese.  With Lea Padovani, Leonardo Cortese, Sandro Ruffini, Lauro Gazzolo.
Directed by Fridrikh Ermler.  With Boris Babochkin, Viktor Khokhryakov, Galina Inyutina, Yuriy Tolubeev.
Directed by Jacopo Comin, Sidney Salkow.  With Richard Greene, Valentina Cortese, Greta Gynt, Massimo Serato.

Directed by Montgomery Tully, Romolo Marcellini, Emil E. Reinert.  With Bonar Colleano, Barbara Kelly, Anne Vernon, Karin Himboldt. An Englishman has been working in the US so long he now speaks with an American accent. He is drafted into the British Army during WWII but is injured and loses his memory. Because he talks like an American, the doctors repatriate him to the States where he is housed with a New York family. After the war they all travel throughout Europe, searching for the women he still remembers in the hope of ...

Directed by Riccardo Freda.  With Amedeo Nazzari, Gianna Maria Canale, Armando Francioli, Arnoldo Foà. Pietro, an honest businessman, is wrongly accused of the murder of his business associate and jailed. Actually the man is alive and has set him up to avoid bankruptcy. Pietro's life is shattered of course and when after many years he is released from prison, he seeks revenge.
Directed by Giuseppe De Martino.  With Lori Landi, Gino Mattera, Jacqueline Pierreux, Afro Poli.

Directed by Gilberto Martínez Solares.  With Germán Valdés, Rebeca Iturbide, Marcelo Chávez, Famie Kaufman. A low-class baker accidentally gets to know an attractive but bitter fiancée. By getting her snobby, dead-pan family to spend some time with his scumbag friends, he changes their lives, while at the time stealing the girl's heart.

primaryTitle: Under the Skies of the Asturias
desc: Directed by Gonzalo Delgrás.  With Isabel de Castro, Augusto Ordóñez, Luis Pérez de León, José Luis González.

Directed by José Antonio Nieves Conde.  With Fernando Fernán Gómez, María Rosa Salgado, Dina Sten, Luis Prendes. Javier is used to make the best of his military life. When a companion is killed in his place, he makes up his mind and enters religious life. Reencountering his rich and spoiled family will show him that not all the battles were fought during the war.

Directed by Christian-Jaque.  With Cécile Aubry, Pierre Brasseur, Jean Debucourt, Robert Arnoux. What to do when you are nicknamed Bluebeard and you have lost your your sixth wife? Marry a seventh one of course! This time around, Count de Salfère has chosen young Aline, the innkeeper's daughter. So much the worse if the belle already has a lover in the person of Giglio, little does it matter that the villagers accuse Bluebeard of having murdered his former wives, the proud papa says yes to ...

Directed by Carlo Campogalliani.  With Silvana Pampanini, Delia Scala, Franca Marzi, Peppino De Filippo. Two chorus girls leave Milan to get to the famous Totò's theatre company. Unfortunately the bus they are on breaks down and they ask for a lift. The driver gets, however, too fresh with the two girls and they decide to continue the journey with any means of transport, bikes included.
Directed by Robert Dhéry.  With Robert Dhéry, Gérard Calvi, Roger Saget, Robert Destain.
Directed by Marcel Blistène.  With Maurice Baquet, Colette Darfeuil, Alexandre Rignault, Yves Robert. Bibi Fricotin is looking for the Z trunk to restore to Catherine the heritage of her ancestors.

Directed by Fernando Cerchio.  With Raf Vallone, Charles Vanel, Claudine Dupuis, Saro Urzì. After the war, Aldo and his men became gangster. But now the times are changing and Aldo decides to became a policeman to help better his men in crime. He meets Giovanna and falls for her. But he begins liking his new job and after their first robbery, Aldo tries to leave his old accomplices...

Directed by Marc Allégret.  With Mai Zetterling, Dirk Bogarde, Fay Compton, Robert Flemyng. Mrs. Christopher (Fay Compton), a kindly volunteer worker at a large hospital, does a favor for a patient by delivering a sum of money to Mr. Sine (James Robertson Justice). When she discovers he is a blackmailer, she threatens to expose him, and a struggle ensues in which she kills him. Her willingness to take the law into her own hands has a disastrous effect on former victims of the ...

Directed by Philip Ford.  With Michael Chapin, Eilene Janssen, James Bell, Hugh O'Brian. At the end of the Civil War, Sam White returns home to his ranch in the Texas ranch -The Panhandle - to find it in the hands of a gang of outlaws. The gang is led by Sam's foreman, Jim Tulane, who because of unsettled conditions throughout the state, has been able to use the ranch as a base for his outlaw empire. The ranch comprises an entire county and Sam had given Tuland power-of-attorney to ...

Directed by Giorgio Bianchi.  With Gino Cervi, Milly Vitale, Frank Latimore, Francesco Golisano. It is 1917, the period of the First World War when Italy is fighting Austria-Hungary. Lucilla di Torrebruna leaves high school and returns to her father, a colonel in the cavalry, who lives at San Donà di Piave. He tells her that his next wife is going to be Helène, a foreign lady. Lucilla takes the news calmly, pleased that her father has found happiness, although she receives a somewhat cold ...
Directed by Mario Costa.  With Leonardo Cortese, Delia Scala, Tamara Lees, Claudio Villa.
Directed by Giorgio Ansoldi, Alberto Pozzetti.  With Steve Barclay, Marina Berti, Paul Muller, Marisa Merlini.

Directed by Luis Marquina.  With Sara Montiel, Fernando Fernán Gómez, Amparo Martí, José Isbert. In Madrid, under Queen Isabel II reign, rebellions are frequent events. During one of them Captain Jorge de Córdoba, nicknamed Veneno (poison) for his quarrelsome disposition, bad temper and outright misogyny, is hurt and taken to a house where two women, a widow and her daughter, are to take care of him.

Directed by Alejandro Galindo.  With Luis Aguilar, Alicia Caro, Agustín Isunza, Julio Villarreal. A young captain is pursued by the Mexican government for defending the rights of the peasants from injustices.

Directed by Richard Pottier.  With Martine Carol, Alfred Adam, Jacques Baumer, Paul Bernard. 14th July 1789. While the wedding of her older unprepossessing sister Louise to a wealthy aristocrat is being celebrated, sixteen-year old beauty Caroline falls in love with an attractive young libertine. But Gaston won't hear of marriage and out of spite she weds Georges Berthier, a politician. Two years later she meets Gaston again and once again it is love at first sight. But her husband being...
Directed by John Cromwell.  With Lizabeth Scott, Jane Greer, Dennis O'Keefe, Fay Baker. Follows the progress of a female ex-convict as she tries to rebuild her life after being released from prison.
Directed by Luis Saslavsky.  With María Félix, Rossano Brazzi, Vittorio Gassman, José María Lado. An amnesiac woman discovers her past was that of criminal.

Directed by Ricardo Gascón.  With Cesare Danova, Juny Orly, Isabel de Pomés, Félix de Pomés. A ship carrying a secret message from Napoleon to Spain is drowned by the English garrison in Menorcan waters. A Spanish nobleman, a French captain and a Maltese gunner become prisoners and conceive a plan to protect the message.

Directed by Fernando de Fuentes.  With Roberto Cañedo, Lilia Prado, Carlos López Moctezuma, Luis Beristáin. An adaptation of Fiodor's Dostoievsky novel Crime and Punishment set in the XX Century Mexico. Ramón Bernal is a poor student in Mexico City that has abandoned his career when he receives a letter informing him that his sister will marry a rich man. Thinking she will marry for money instead of love and feeling guilty about this he murders an old usurer to steal her money. With feelings of guilt ...
Directed by Ernesto Cortázar.  With Roberto Cañedo, Lilia del Valle, Javier Jiménez, José Torvay.

Directed by Curzio Malaparte.  With Raf Vallone, Rina Morelli, Alain Cuny, Anna Maria Ferrero. Back in his village, former war prisoner Bruno Baldi is dead set on avenging his brother who has been shot by a German firing squad after being given away by a villager. But nobody wants to give him the name of the culprit. At long last, Antonio, a joiner, reveals the informer but this comes at a cost.

Directed by Stanley Kubrick.  With Douglas Edwards, Nat Fleischer, Walter Cartier, Vincent Cartier. After a short study of boxing's history, narrated by newscaster Douglas Edwards, we follow a day in the life of a middleweight Irish boxer named Walter Cartier.
Directed by Ramón Torrado.  With Paquita Rico, Alfredo Mayo, Lina Yegros, Lola Ramos. The story of a gypsy girl and her relation with a painter whom she poses for.

Directed by Roberto Gavaldón.  With Dolores del Rio, Jorge Mistral, José Baviera, Anabelle Gutiérrez. Deseada, a woman living in the modern city of Chichen Itza, tries to assuage her sister's dread of her betrothal to a Spaniard she doesn't really know. However, when he arrives in the city, he and Deseada fall in love before he has a chance to meet his bride-to-be.
Directed by Leonid Lukov.  With Boris Chirkov, Aleksey Gribov, A. Mansvetov, G. Pasechnik.
Directed by Charles Barton.  With Donald O'Connor, Helena Carter, Will Geer, John Emery. After being falsely accused of dishonesty, a young man decides to become a pirate.
Directed by Alejandro Galindo.  With Dolores del Rio, Esther Fernández, Carlos Navarro, Julio Villarreal.
Directed by Mario Camerini.  With Kieron Moore, Griffith Jones, Lea Padovani, Sally Ann Howes.

Directed by Jacques Becker.  With Daniel Gélin, Anne Vernon, Elina Labourdette, Jacques François. Edouard is a pianist, married with Caroline. This evening, they are invited to Claude's. Claude is the snobbish uncle of Caroline, his son Alain (as snobbish as his father) is in love with Caroline. They spite Edouard a little because he's poor. At the party, Edouard must play the piano to make himself known by Claude's important acquaintances. But just before leaving, Edouard and Caroline ...

primaryTitle: In the Palm of Your Hand
originalTitle: En la palma de tu mano
desc: Directed by Roberto Gavaldón.  With Arturo de Córdova, Leticia Palma, Ramón Gay, Consuelo Guerrero de Luna. A fortune teller blackmails a beautiful widow whose husband has recently died.
Directed by Ricardo Gascón.  With Cesare Danova, Juny Orly, Rafael Calvo, Carmen Rey.
Directed by Anthony Kimmins.  With Richard Todd, Glynis Johns, Joan Greenwood, André Morell.

Directed by Lawrence Huntington.  With Michael Denison, Dulcie Gray, Anthony Nicholls, Marjorie Fielding. Michael Denison plays a lawyer investigating kidnapping charges against Dulcie Gray. Based on a novel of Josephine Tey.
Directed by Rudolf Jugert.  With Olga Tschechowa, Gustav Knuth, Rudolf Prack, Siegfried Breuer.
Directed by Georg Jacoby.  With Eva Pawlik, Herta Mayen, Hans Holt, Oskar Sima.

Directed by Rogelio A. González.  With Pedro Infante, Antonio Badú, Lilia Prado, Ana María Villaseñor. A lady's man that goes town to town capturing the love of beautiful women till he meet a greater love the love of a true friend. But there is nothing worst than the wrath of a women with a broken heart.
Directed by Harald Reinl.  With Karl Loven, Harriet Geßner, Rudolf Schatzberg, Gerd Deutschmann.
Directed by Harry Hasso.  With Hansi Knoteck, Mady Rahl, Elise Aulinger, Elisabeth Biebl.
Directed by Robert Z. Leonard.  With Van Johnson, Kathryn Grayson, Paula Raymond, Barry Sullivan. Opera singer Ina Massine tries to win back former husband Dr. Lincoln I. Bartlett.

Directed by Robert Hessens, Alain Resnais.  With María Casares, Jacques Pruvost. On April 26 1937 the small Basque town of Guernica was bombed without warning by the German aviation. Two thousand people, all civilians, got killed. Like millions all over the world, Pablo Picasso was shocked and he translated his emotion into a magnificent but terrifying picture bearing the name of the martyred city. This film does not only comment on the painting, it also gives it a new life ...
Directed by Lewis Milestone.  With Richard Widmark, Jack Palance, Reginald Gardiner, Robert Wagner. A company of Marines races against the clock to find a Japanese rocket base.

Directed by Joseph M. Newman.  With George Raft, Coleen Gray, Enzo Staiola, Charles Goldner. American gambler Nick Cain arrives at the Mediterranean town of San Paola, and befriends an orphan Italian shoe-shine boy named Toni. He is puzzled by the reception and welcome he receives from the management of the casino until he finds he has been framed on a charge of murdering a U.S. Treasury Agent. He escapes with Kay Wonderly and they flee to a deserted village where he leaves Kay to hide ...

Directed by Giorgio Simonelli.  With Renato Rascel, Silvana Pampanini, Virgilio Riento, Marilyn Buferd. The young Uguccione is mistaken for Rascelito Villa called "C6", a dangerous revolutionary, and then immediately sent to Parazuela where he leads the insurrectionist troops.

Directed by Emilio Fernández.  With Pedro Infante, Rosaura Revueltas, Rocío Sagaón, Esther Luquín. The live and hardship of the inmates at Las Islas Marias Penal Colony, a Mexican Federal Corrections Center placed on these very wild islands.

Directed by Robert Bresson.  With Claude Laydu, Nicole Ladmiral, Jean Riveyre, Adrien Borel. A young priest taking over the parish at Ambricourt tries to fulfill his duties even as he fights a mysterious stomach ailment.

originalTitle: Juliette ou La clef des songes
desc: Directed by Marcel Carné.  With Gérard Philipe, Suzanne Cloutier, Jean-Roger Caussimon, René Génin. Michel has stolen from his employer, Mr Bellanger, for the love of Juliette. He is now in jail. One night, while sleeping in his cell, he wakes up all of a sudden, the gates open and he finds himself in a strange village where all the inhabitants have lost their memory. There, meets Juliette again who seems to agree to marry a powerful man, who might well be Bluebeard...

Directed by Guy Lefranc.  With Louis Jouvet, Jean Brochard, Pierre Renoir, Pierre Bertin. Saint-Maurice, an ordinary peaceful village, lived healthily so much so that the local doctor's practice was scant. But that was before Dr. Parpalaid retired and was replaced by a charlatan by the name of Knock. A real genius this one, for he soon managed to persuade everyone that they were ill. And not only didn't they resent him but they even loved their physician, who made a fortune and ...
Directed by Márton Keleti.  With Gyula Benkö, Miklós Gábor, Lajos Rajczy, Hédi Temessy.

Directed by Lesley Selander.  With Tim Holt, Joan Dixon, Robert Livingston, Leonard Penn. The Texas Rangers send Dave and Chito into the badlands to see if they can locate a counterfeiting operation. They arrive posing as wanted outlaws and this gets them into the gang. But as soon as they uncover the operation and locate the printing press, one of Chito's girl friends arrives to expose their identity and they find themselves trapped by the entire gang.

Directed by Juan de Orduña.  With Amparo Rivelles, Virgilio Teixeira, Alfredo Mayo, Manuel Luna. Juan de Padilla, one of the main leaders of the Comuneros, is executed in the presence of his wife, Maria Pacheco, who, with his son, decides to avenge his death. Maria, Spanish lady of the highest rank, of delicate health but strong in spirit, heroic reacts and participates in dangerous exploits against the tyranny of King Charles V, becoming "Leona de Castilla", symbol of the oppressed popular ...
Directed by Arturo Ruiz Castillo.  With Fernando Aguirre, Rafael Albaicín, Mario Berriatúa, Félix Briones.

originalTitle: Les miracles n'ont lieu qu'une fois
desc: Directed by Yves Allégret.  With Alida Valli, Jean Marais, Marcelle Arnold, Christine Chesnay. 1939 : what a beautiful year for Claudia and Jerôme. No sooner do they meet that they are under each other's spell. 1939 : what a horrible year for the two lovers : war breaks out before they can get married. They meet again after the war but the enchantment has vanished. They decide to marry but it will be for reason, not for love. Miracles only happen once.

Directed by Carlos Véjar hijo.  With Jorge Mistral, Emilia Guiú, Armando Calvo, Carmen Montejo. An all star cast is featured in several vignettes about what motivates people to pawn their valuable items for ready cash at "Monte de piedad", Mexico City's top pawn shop.

Directed by Alfredo B. Crevenna.  With Alicia Caro, Lupe Carriles, Irasema Dilián, María Douglas. Irasema Dilián stars as the orphan Manuela whose passionate crush on her teacher Lucila (Marga Lopez) scandalizes their all-girl Catholic school. An exceptional Mexican remake of the 1931 German original, Maedchen in Uniform.

Directed by Ernesto Cortázar.  With Miroslava, Fernando Fernández, Jorge Reyes, Esperanza Issa. Rivas is an insurance sales man who hadn't been lucky in his life. He offered many times to live less years in exchange of a better live. Tasia (the dead) came for him, since he had wasted all the years to live. Tasia offer him some extra days for living in exchange to stay with him at home to understand better this world. This is a comedy with a similar story line to Meet Joe Black filmed many ...

Directed by Ismael Rodríguez.  With Pedro Infante, Lilia Prado, Chula Prieto, Miguel Manzano. Infante stars as a rebel general caught up in a tempestuous romantic tug-of-war between two women: ex-girlfriend (Chula Prieto) and wife (Lilia Prado). This love triangle yields devastating consequences as they must face the governmental soldiers during the revolution.

Directed by Pierre Chenal.  With Richard Wright, Jean Wallace, Nicholas Joy, Gloria Madison. In 1940s Chicago, a young black man takes a job as a chauffeur to a white family, which takes a turn for the worse when he accidentally kills the teenage daughter of the couple and then tries to cover it up.

Directed by Ivan Dukinsky, Sergey Gerasimov, Siao-Bin Siu.  With Zedong Mao, Feng Zhou. The first feature about the PRC shown in the US, showing workers in cooperatives, youth at school, mass athletic events, holiday parades, and leaders making speeches; the friendship with the USSR is stressed.

Directed by Jacqueline Audry.  With Edwige Feuillère, Simone Simon, Marie-Claire Olivia, Yvonne de Bray. Late nineteenth century in a finishing school for young girls near in France, the principal, the fascinating Miss Julie, sows confusion in the heart of the newcomer, Olivia.

Directed by George P. Breakston, C. Ray Stahl.  With Byron Michie, Martha Hyer, Tetsu Nakamura, Richard Binge. Set in post war Japan, an American woman tries to clear her brother's reputation as a drug smuggler after his apparent suicide. She gets help from a seemingly kind Englishman.
Directed by Maurice Cloche.  With Roberto Adamina, Nerio Bernardi, Luigi Casciano, Guido Celano. This film is about St Francis of Assisi, the patron St of animals.

Directed by Luigi Comencini.  With Massimo Girotti, Eleonora Rossi Drago, Giulietta Masina, Liliana Gerace. Sandra searches for her missing sister. For this, she enters the morally degraded seaside of Genoa.

Directed by Jerzy Bossak, Joris Ivens.  With Andrzej Lapicki. A Communist supported report of a peace conference held in Poland during the first year of the Korean War, which also documents the destruction launched upon Korea by US bombing .

Directed by Basil Dearden.  With Bonar Colleano, Susan Shaw, Renée Asherson, Earl Cameron. When their ship docks the crew disembark as usual to pick up their lives in postwar London. For one of them his petty smuggling turns more serious when he finds himself caught up with a robbery in the City.
Directed by John Gilling.  With Derek Bond, Jane Hylton, Dora Bryan, Michael Balfour. Coastal pub proprietress is inveigled into a smuggling plot.

Directed by Leslie Fenton.  With Glenn Ford, Edmond O'Brien, Rhonda Fleming, Alan Reed. Framed for murder during the Civil War, Gil Kyle's only alibi is Confederate agent Candace Bronson who he must track down in dangerous territory filled with foes.

Directed by John Rawlins.  With Rory Calhoun, Peter Graves, Frank Fenton, Ralph Sanford. The story of two step-brothers, raised by their father, the chief of police, in a small Oregon lumber town. One brother is hard-working, always within the law, the other a 'rogue.' When gold dust comes up missing from a crime scene, brother is pitted against brother and the father sides against one of the brothers.
Directed by Marcello Pagliero.  With André Bellec, Georges Bellec, François Soubeyran, Paul Tourenne. The Brothers Jacques, who were to sing that night at "The Red Rose", are failing.

Directed by Jean-Paul Le Chanois.  With Bernard Blier, Danièle Delorme, Pierre Trabaud, Arlette Marchal. Thérèse Ravenaz is a charming young woman but also the victim of a seducer who abandoned her as soon as he was told she was expecting a baby. To trace her unworthy lover, she boards a taxi driven by Emile Gauthier, a friendly cabdriver, who accepts to help her. But street after street, district after district, the seducer is nowhere to be found in Paris. And when she finally achieves the end of ...
Directed by Boris Barnet.  With Nina Arkhipova, Nikolay Kryuchkov, Viktor Dobrovolsky, Marina Bebutova.
Directed by Roberto Bianchi Montero.  With Gino Cervi, Delia Scala, Otello Toso, Olga Solbelli.
Directed by Luis Suárez de Lezo.  With Rafael Bardem, José Luis Brugada, Rafael Calvo, Antonio Casas.

Directed by Miguel M. Delgado.  With Cantinflas, Alma Rosa Aguirre, Miguel Ángel Ferriz, Miguel Inclán. In order to woo Rosario, Margarito pretends to be the famous outlaw "Siete Machos", called like that because "he possesses the courage of seven macho men".

Directed by Julien Duvivier.  With Brigitte Auber, Jean Brochard, René Blancard, Paul Frankeur. Fates of multiple otherwise disconnected characters intertwine miraculously under the sky of Paris. And it all happens in one day.

Directed by Luigi Capuano.  With Constance Dowling, Andrea Checchi, Aldo Silvani, Bianca Doria. An American journalist, Barbara, goes to Italy to interview Roi, the country's most notorious outlaw when she imagines to be some kind of modern-day Robin Hood. Through local contacts and friends, she arranges a meeting and finds that her "robin-hood'" is just a hood, hoodlum and ruthless criminal. The police are about to capture him but he uses her as an hostage to make his escape but they are ...

Directed by Robert Vernay.  With Luis Mariano, Carmen Sevilla, Arlette Poirier, Perrette Souplex. Having fallen out with his girlfriend Dolorès, Juanito leaves for Mexico, where he becomes a famous matador.There he meets a Viennese singer, Fanny Miller, who falls for him so much so that she intercepts the letters Dolorès keeps on sending him. In desperation, Dolorès devotes all her time and efforts to dance and she becomes the celebrated dancer Estrellita. After a series of misunderstandings ...

Directed by Luis Buñuel.  With Rosita Quintana, Fernando Soler, Víctor Manuel Mendoza, María Gentil Arcos. An unstable young woman escapes from a reformatory for very, very wayward girls and deceptively finds shelter in the kind home of a frighteningly nice and decent family. Little by little, she causes unrest and discord among the members of the household, until they are virtually fighting with each other.

Directed by Ladislao Vajda.  With Adriano Domínguez, Raúl Cancio, Carlota Bilbao, José María Rodero. An urban newspaper's seventh page ("séptima página") is a compendium of society events and varied incidents, each one reflecting an individual story beyond the written words.
Directed by Kurt Meisel.  With Kurt Meisel, Paul Hörbiger, Margot Hielscher, Ernst Waldbrunn.

Directed by Godfrey Grayson.  With Avis Scott, Patrick Barr, Robert Ayres, Harry Fine. In this melodrama, a man is permanently crippled in a horseback riding accident and then learns that he will soon die. He spends his last few days taking care of his family and trying to get his wife to find another man.

Directed by W. Lee Wilder.  With Lloyd Bridges, Lea Padovani, Aldo Fabrizi, William Tubbs. After a prison sentence an American GI stationed in Italy discovers that his hidden loot has disappeared and goes searching for it.

Directed by Norman Dawn.  With Kasey Rogers, James Arness, Bill Kennedy, Gloria Petroff. When the American clipper ship "The Queen" is attacked by pirates off the Hebrides in 1830, Mate Kirk Hamilton is injured and must be put ashore at Queensland Colony, Australia, for treatment and recuperation. There, he meets and falls in love with Elaine Jeffries, daughter of the magistrate and all-but-fiancée to rancher Martin Shannon. She also finds herself attracted to Kirk, and a rivalry ...
Directed by Ted Tetzlaff.  With Richard Conte, Audrey Totter, John McIntire, Sam Jaffe. When a cunning, unscrupulous mobster is sentenced to a Florida prison farm, he launches a deadly escape plan.
Directed by Veit Harlan.  With Kristina Söderbaum, Hans Holt, Hermann Schomberg, Alexander Golling.
Directed by Vladimir Braun.  With Nikolai Timofeyev, Arkadi Tolbuzin, Aleksandr Grechanyy, Sergei Gurzo.

Directed by Emilio Fernández.  With Ninón Sevilla, Tito Junco, Rodolfo Acosta, Rita Montaner. In México City, a Cuban dancer from "Cabaret Changó" rescues a baby from a garbage can and decides to raise him, but her pachuco pimp gets in her way.
Directed by Karl Hartl.  With Bobby Henrey, Elwyn Brook-Jones, Muriel Aked, Oskar Werner.
Directed by Keisuke Kinoshita.  With Masayuki Mori, Chikage Awashima, Rentarô Mikuni, Yôko Katsuragi.

Directed by Jean Grémillon.  With Michèle Morgan, Henri Vidal, Arlette Thomas, Louise Conte. Can a person really lead a double life? It looks as though Irène can. On the one hand, she is the wife of Jacques Voisin-Larive, a big name in the publishing world. On the other hand she pretends to be a simple chambermaid when she is with Etienne, a handsome young cabinetmaker. But what will happen when Irène gets pregnant?
Directed by Lasse Pöysti.  With Irma Seikkula, Leena Häkinen, Erkki Viljos, Jussi Jurkka.
Directed by Otto Preminger.  With Linda Darnell, Charles Boyer, Michael Rennie, Constance Smith. Respectable citizens receive anonymous letters revealing their adulterous relationships.

Directed by Gösta Bernhard.  With Gus Dahlström, Holger Höglund, Fritiof Billquist, Irene Söderblom. 91:ans regiment prepares a military maneuver, but the staff are missing an important map over the operation and the turmoil increases.

Directed by Ismael Rodríguez.  With Pedro Infante, Luis Aguilar, Aurora Segura, Alma Delia Fuentes. A drifter lands a job as an officer in México City's elite motorcycle police unit and gets home with a mate of this unit. The mate is in love with a girl, but he and she are always making jealous to each other. The drifter and the mate get involved themselves in a fight to become the winner of conquering ladies and performing unit acrobatic tricks, interfering with their friendship and profession.
Directed by Robert A. Stemmle.  With Paolo Stoppa, Camillo Pilotto, Walter Chiari, Antonella Lualdi.

primaryTitle: Bud Abbott Lou Costello Meet the Invisible Man
originalTitle: Bud Abbott Lou Costello Meet the Invisible Man
desc: Directed by Charles Lamont.  With Bud Abbott, Lou Costello, Nancy Guild, Arthur Franz. Two bumbling private eyes help a man wrongly accused of murder who has become invisible to help clear his name.

Directed by Lewis D. Collins.  With Whip Wilson, Andy Clyde, Tommy Farrell, Steve Clark. Fleeing a sheriff's posse after being unjustly accused as horse-thieves, Dave "Kansas Kid" Hill and Sagebrush Charlie are befriended by Ed Dawson, who is wounded while helping them escape. Kansas take Ed to a doctor in Tonto City, and Ed offers them jobs with his father's trail herd. They report to Dawson's foreman, Slavens, who instead sends them to the rival Coulter outfit. Suspicious to ...

Directed by Mario Mattoli.  With Riccardo Billi, Mario Riva, Dorian Gray, Aroldo Tieri. Count Borraccilo lives in luxury but does not pay taxes and for this he is targeted by the tax agent Gaetano Pellecchia, who asks his friend Mario for help.

Directed by Jean Yarbrough.  With Spring Byington, Anthony Caruso, Tanis Chandler, Brett King. Mrs. Hoyle, a retired school teacher, resides in a hotel bought by Morganti, a gangster, who evicts most of the tenants but allows Mrs. Hoyle and Angela Brown, a dance-hall girl to remain. Mrs. Hoyle's influence for good is felt quickly by Morganti and all of his henchmen with the exception of Rogan. Ther latter, despite Morganti's orders to go straight robs a market with his accomplice Slatterty...

Directed by Carlo Lizzani.  With Gina Lollobrigida, Andrea Checchi, Vittorio Duse, Lamberto Maggiorani. About a group of Italian resistance fighters from Genoa and led by Commander Vento. They must seize a shipment of weapons destined for the German occupation.

Directed by William A. Wellman.  With Clark Gable, Ricardo Montalban, John Hodiak, Adolphe Menjou. Trapper Flint Mitchell and other mountain men from the Rendezvous join forces to enter virgin trapping territory but must contend with a resentful Blackfoot chief.

Directed by David MacDonald.  With Dennis Price, Jack Hawkins, Siobhan McKenna, Peter Hammond. As the Boer War ends a South African soldier hides a cache of diamonds he finds on a body. He returns to the town he left three years earlier where his girl has married a disgraced English officer. Needing funds to get back to pick up the diamonds the Boer enlists the help of a fellow soldier as well as the Englishman and a local hotel keeper. This ill-assorted bunch set off into the bush intent ...

Directed by William Marshall, Robert Florey.  With Errol Flynn, Micheline Presle, Vincent Price, Agnes Moorehead. A sea captain becomes involved with a servant girl in early New Orleans. She sees him as a way to gain access into wealthy households.

Directed by John Huston.  With Humphrey Bogart, Katharine Hepburn, Robert Morley, Peter Bull. In WWI Africa, a gin-swilling riverboat captain is persuaded by a strait-laced missionary to use his boat to attack an enemy warship.

desc: Directed by Senkichi Taniguchi.  With Ryô Ikebe, Mitsuko Mito, Toshirô Mifune, Takashi Shimura. A young man, convicted of a crime and imprisoned in the penitentiary, comes to believe that his wife is being unfaithful to him. He contrives his escape from the prison in order to seek her out and learn the truth, but the police give chase and he must flee into the mountains.
Directed by Joseph Pevney.  With Stephen McNally, Gail Russell, Alex Nicol, Richard Long. A group of cadets have assorted problems at the U.S. Air Force Pilot Training Academy.

Directed by Kaneto Shindô.  With Nobuko Otowa, Jûkichi Uno, Ichirô Sugai, Denjirô Ôkôchi. Shindo's directorial debut is the fictionalized account of the death of his first wife. Following the breakout of the Pacific War, the Japanese film industry was forcibly downsized. Numazaki, a mediocre screenwriter, faces imminent dismissal. His wife Takako encourages him to seek work in Kyoto. Numazaki fails his aptitude test, which is to write a script for the famous but demanding director ...
Directed by Ray Nazarro.  With Dan Duryea, Gale Storm, Dick Foran, Gloria Henry. Bank robber serves his time in prison, tries to go straight.

Directed by Juan de Orduña.  With Antonio Vilar, María Martín, José Suárez, Virgilio Teixeira. The story of Cristóbal Colón's tribulations to get financial support for a maritime expedition which should have provided a new commercial route to the Far East but discovered America instead.

Directed by Clyde Geronimi, Wilfred Jackson, Hamilton Luske.  With Kathryn Beaumont, Ed Wynn, Richard Haydn, Sterling Holloway. Alice stumbles into the world of Wonderland. Will she get home? Not if the Queen of Hearts has her way.

Directed by William F. Claxton.  With Houseley Stevenson, Donald Woods, Onslow Stevens, Robert Stevenson. Dr. Charles Greyson is a famous and wealthy former surgeon. His nephews have taken him to court to challenge his competency, due to his recent inexplicable gifts of large amounts of cash to the church, and, apparently, to some nefarious scam artists. The film is portrayed as a courtroom drama first painting "Dr. Charlie" as incompetent and easily swindled, then telling his side of events and ...

Directed by Raoul Walsh.  With Kirk Douglas, Virginia Mayo, John Agar, Walter Brennan. A U.S. Marshall and two deputies rescue a cattle rustler from a lynch mob led by a local cattle baron convinced that the rustler also killed his son.
Directed by Franz Antel.  With Paul Hörbiger, Maria Andergast, Inge Konradi, Johanna Matz.

Directed by Vincente Minnelli.  With Gene Kelly, Leslie Caron, Oscar Levant, Georges Guétary. Three friends struggle to find work in Paris. Things become more complicated when two of them fall in love with the same woman.

Directed by Baccio Bandini.  With Umberto Spadaro, Delia Scala, Andrea Bosic, Marco Vicario. A woman has jumped or been pushed from five stories of an apartment house. The detective on the case lives there, and he discovers that the woman's estranged husband does also. She had been extorting money from him and had threatened to kill herself if he didn't pay. The detective's daughter is in love with the husband and tries to provide an alibi for him. But when a genuine alibi is proved, ...
Directed by Giorgio Bianchi.  With Renato Rascel, Gina Lollobrigida, Franca Marzi, Aroldo Tieri.
Directed by Marino Girolami.  With Maria Montez, Massimo Serato, Hans Söhnker, Carlo Giustini.
Directed by Phani Majumdar.  With Kishore Kumar, Gauri Devi, Krishnakant, Bhojwani.

Directed by Clarence Brown.  With Paul Douglas, Janet Leigh, Keenan Wynn, Donna Corcoran. A young woman reporter blames the Pittsburgh Pirates' losing streak on the obscenely abusive manager. While she attempts to learn more about him for her column, he begins hearing the voice of an angel promising him help for the team if he will mend his ways. As he does so, an orphan girl who is a Pirates fan and has been praying for the team begins noticing angels on the ballfield. Sure enough, ...
Directed by Alberto Lattuada.  With Silvana Mangano, Gaby Morlay, Raf Vallone, Jacques Dumesnil. Anna is a nurse and a nun, whose history catches up on her.

Directed by Jacques Tourneur.  With Jean Peters, Louis Jourdan, Debra Paget, Herbert Marshall. In order to recover his ship impounded by the British, former pirate captain LaRochelle agrees to spy on the notorious Caribbean Sea pirates Blackbeard and Anne Providence.

Directed by Hugo Fregonese.  With Stephen McNally, Coleen Gray, Willard Parker, Arthur Shields. A gambler is thrown out of a western town, but returns when the town is suddenly threatened by a band of marauding Apaches.

Directed by Ralph Thomas.  With David Niven, Glynis Johns, George Coulouris, Barry Jones. During WW2, British Major Valentine Moreland is tasked with rescuing a prized pedigree cow from the German-occupied Channel Island of Armorel.

Directed by Fred C. Brannon.  With Michael Chapin, Eilene Janssen, James Bell, Lucille Barkley. Female gang boss poses as welfare worker come to take charge of outlaw's orphaned niece, in order to break the rest of the gang from jail.

Directed by Mario Mattoli.  With Walter Chiari, Mario Riva, Riccardo Billi, Lisetta Nava. A ruthless businessman wants to bring a penniless nobleman financially on his knees because he wants to marry the man's daughter. It is the family chauffeur who puts things right.

Directed by Bernard Girard.  With William Tracy, Joe Sawyer, Russell Hicks, John Ridgely. Oh, those Army daze and nights! An infusion of WAC beauties adds to the fun when ex-G.I. "Dodo" Doubleday (William Tracy), now a hotel clerk, impresses Army brass with his memory and considers going back into the military. But recruiting station sergeant Bill Ames (Joe Sawyer), remembering how Tracy jinxed him back in WWII days, begs him not to re-enlist!
Directed by Harmon Jones.  With Monty Woolley, Thelma Ritter, David Wayne, Jean Peters. A 65-year-old printer hatches an elaborate scheme to avoid forced retirement.

Directed by Claude Autant-Lara.  With Fernandel, Françoise Rosay, Marie-Claire Olivia, Jean-Roger Caussimon. A group of travelers, including a monk, stay in a lonely inn in the mountains. The host confesses the monk his habit of serving a soporific soup to the guests, to rob their possessions and to bury them in the backyard. The story unfolds as the monk tries to save the guest's lives without violating the holy secrecy of the confession.

Directed by Giorgio Simonelli.  With Delia Scala, Maria Grazia Francia, Giovanna Pala, Ugo Tognazzi. Three friends, a mechanic a clockmaker and a night warden are engaged to three sisters but are broke and cannot get married and pay the rent. They convince their future father in law to buy three little flats for them but the man buys them from a swindler and the friends run the risk of going to prison.

Directed by Raj Kapoor.  With Raj Kapoor, Nargis, Prithviraj Kapoor, K.N. Singh. A poor young man named Raj joins a criminal gang to feed his mother. But when he falls in love with Rita, he decides to reform himself for her.

Directed by Guru Dutt.  With Dev Anand, Geeta Bali, Kalpana Kartik, Roopa Verman. An ace gambler is forced to join a gambling syndicate in order to pay for the treatment of his ill sister and is framed for murder when he expresses his desire to get out.

Directed by Jules White.  With Moe Howard, Larry Fine, Shemp Howard, Lynn Davies. The stooges are facing eviction and decide to raise some money by becoming baby-sitters. Their first client is a women separated from her husband, who entrusts her son "Junior" to the boys' care. When The husband steals the baby, the stooges set out to find their missing charge and return him to his mother. The boys confront the husband and find Junior, and in the process the estranged couple is ...

Directed by Asbjørn Andersen, Jens Henriksen.  With Ib Schønberg, Lily Broberg, Preben Lerdorff Rye, Asbjørn Andersen. Behind the red gates in Klampenborg, Dyrhaven spreads in all its lush toppings old oak trees and light green beeches, a favorite excursion place that is used extensively every summer.

Directed by M.V. Raman.  With Karan Dewan, Vyjayanthimala, Pran, Om Prakash. A singer and dancer par excellence, Lata lives a wealthy lifestyle with her dad, Choudhry Goverdhanlal Patwardhanlal and mom. Her parents would like her to get married to wealthy Shekhar, who she initially approves of. Shortly thereafter she meets with Vasant Kumar and both fall in love with each other. When Shekhar finds out that Lata does not want to marry him, he is enraged and starts to ...
Directed by Fedor Hanzekovic.  With Misa Mirkovic, Milan Ajvaz, Josip Petricic, Vaso Kosic. A young man's fight between love and the monastic discipline.

Directed by Keigo Kimura.  With Toshirô Mifune, Machiko Kyô, Takashi Shimura, Ichirô Sugai. This early gem starring the great Mifune Toshiro tells the tale of Katakana Yonetaro aka "The Shark," a rough-and-tumble horse trader in Japan's rugged northernmost territory of Hokkaddo.. always ready to drink, fight, gamble and chase women he falls victim to a crooked game with loaded dice. This little-known film captures the wild ways of early Japan after the fall of the shogunate when men had...
Directed by Yasujirô Ozu.  With Setsuko Hara, Chishû Ryû, Chikage Awashima, Kuniko Miyake. A family chooses a match for their daughter Noriko, but she, surprisingly, has her own plans.
Directed by Friz Freleng.  With Mel Blanc. When Yosemite Sam campaigns on a platform including rabbit genocide, Bugs runs against him.
Directed by Don Weis.  With Keefe Brasselle, Sally Forrest, Lionel Barrymore, Lewis Stone. A cub reporter finagled a fake front page showing a dying professor's plan for civic reform.
Directed by Earl McEvoy.  With Robert Cummings, Jerome Courtland, Terry Moore, John Russell. A 19th-century con artist flees to the wilds of Florida to elude the law.

Directed by Felix E. Feist.  With John Ireland, Marshall Thompson, Vanessa Brown, William Bishop. A college basketball star collaborates with organized crime and becomes involved in 'point shaving.' A sportswriter tries to get him back on the right track.

Directed by Chuck Jones.  With Bea Benaderet, Billy Bletcher, Stan Freberg. It's Father's Day, and Junyer and Ma have a bunch of big surprises in store for good ol' Pa, including a pipe filled with gunpowder. To top it off, there's a gala Father's Day pageant, and Pa sits cringing through Junyer's recitation and aghast at Ma's tap-dancing rendition of "I'm Just Wild About Father."

Directed by Frederick De Cordova.  With Ronald Reagan, Diana Lynn, Walter Slezak, Lucille Barkley. A college professor attempts to salvage his personal and professional reputation by using a laboratory chimpanzee to prove that environment trumps heredity in behavioral development.

Directed by Jack Hannah.  With Clarence Nash. Gardener Donald spots bees in his garden and follows them back to the hive in search of honey. The bee guarding the hive won't let him in, so Donald disguises himself as a bee.

Directed by George Beck.  With Farley Granger, Shelley Winters, William Demarest, Francis L. Sullivan. When a cute Welsh terrier follows Bill Denny home, little does he know that all gangland has its eye on that dog. Who will be bumbling Bill's undoing - the gangsters, the cops, or his suspicious mother-in-law?

Directed by Falk Harnack.  With Erwin Geschonneck, Käthe Braun, Gefion Helmke, Willy A. Kleinau. After a crime is committed during the Nazi era in the Reeperbahn area of Hamburg,the aspiring local leader,a ship owner,needs to find an executioner to kill the perpetrators(the crime is blamed on the Communists) and turns to a butcher,who has fallen on hard times and can use the cash.

Directed by Allan Dwan.  With Vera Ralston, John Carroll, William Ching, Hope Emerson. After serving a prison sentence in 1850, a New Orleans woman becomes a rich gambler, opens a casino on the Barbary Coast, gets romantically involved with Nevada mine owners and watches over the interests of her little sister.
Directed by Luchino Visconti.  With Anna Magnani, Walter Chiari, Tina Apicella, Gastone Renzelli. A woman from the lower class desperately tries to get her daughter into the movies.
Directed by Fred Zinnemann.  With Lee Aaker, Neville Brand, Helen Brown, Henry Fonda.
Directed by William D. Russell.  With Robert Ryan, Claire Trevor, Jack Buetel, Robert Preston. The outlaws of the Clanton and Younger gangs are the heroes of this fictionalized biography.

Directed by Emilio Fernández.  With Roberto Cañedo, Columba Domínguez, Julio Villarreal, Tito Junco. Antonio está próximo a casarse con su novia Nieves. Durante un chequeo médico, necesario antes de casarse, los médicos descubren una condición que llevará los sentimientos al extremo.

Directed by Rolf Husberg.  With Åke Grönberg, Åke Söderblom, Lillebil Kjellén, Lennart Lindberg. Biffen and Bananen are two ex bicycle racers who works in the bicycle factory Standard. Biffen is a meat eater, Bananen a vegetarian and they are in constant quarrel.

Directed by Billy Wilder.  With Kirk Douglas, Jan Sterling, Robert Arthur, Porter Hall. A frustrated former big-city journalist now stuck working for an Albuquerque newspaper exploits a story about a man trapped in a cave to rekindle his career, but the situation quickly escalates into an out-of-control circus.

Directed by Lew Landers.  With Wayne Morris, Preston Foster, Dorothy Patrick, Paul E. Burns. Oil-field roughnecks Kenny Blake and Hank Mason, on a drinking spree with Betsy Abbott, buy a piece of worthless oil land from conman Jim Tolman. Cappy Groves, a diviner, locates oil on the property and Betsy arranges to rent drilling equipment from Tolman, with a stipulation that if oil isn't struck within sixty days, the property lease reverts to Tolman.
Directed by Joseph Losey.  With John Drew Barrymore, Preston Foster, Joan Lorring, Howard St. John. A teenager comes of age while seeking revenge on the man who beat up his father.
Directed by Robert McKimson.  With Mel Blanc. An acrobatic bear at Colonel Korny's World Famous Circus finds an unwanted partner in Bugs Bunny.
Directed by Delmer Daves.  With Debra Paget, Louis Jourdan, Jeff Chandler, Everett Sloane. An island Princess falls for a visiting Frenchman, but her people are against it.

Directed by Vernon Sewell.  With Christine Norden, Robert Ayres, Jennifer Jayne, Anthony Forwood. Mark Sherwin ( Robert Ayres) is the victim of a brutal beating and car theft. The thief dies in a crash; Mark suffers from amnesia, and recuperates on a horse-training property. Discovering a clue, he returns home to find he had been declared dead, his wife welcomes him back, only to plan a real death for him so she and his best friend (with whom she is having an affair) can get his substantial ...
Directed by Christian-Jaque.  With Hans Albers, Cécile Aubry, Fritz Kortner, Lina Carstens.

Directed by Wallace Fox.  With Johnny Mack Brown, Lois Hall, House Peters Jr., Stanley Price. Following his refusal to let his daughter Carol marry cowhand Bill Grant, rancher John Roberts is kidnapped, and Bill is hunted for the crime. Carol abandons the ranch which soon earns a reputation of being haunted. Marshal Johnny Mack Brown, investigating a gold bullion robbery, discovers a piece of bone-handle from the kidnapper's gun on the ranch and also a solid gold rifle bullet. He locates ...

Directed by Lew Landers.  With Bill Williams, Jane Nigh, Arthur Shields, Audrey Long. Tim, an old race-horse trainer down on his luck, is thumbing his way from San Francisco to Los Angeles when he is given a ride by Eileen and Sue Buchanan, daughters of a wealthy Southen California race horse breeder. Tim sees "Tanglefoot", a five-year-old he had trained, and learns that the horse is destined for the dog meat packers. Eileen buys the horse with him. Tim is given the trainer job at...

Directed by Curtis Bernhardt, Busby Berkeley.  With Jane Wyman, Charles Laughton, Joan Blondell, Richard Carlson. Louise Mason is a young widow who fills her empty life with the task of becoming a children's nurse. As the years pass, and the widow tries to find her own place in life, her young charges, the children of various employers, grow and soon find themselves ready to face the world. When it seems that she will be alone, the nurse finds that her 'children' have ideas of their own in regards to helping...
Directed by Vera Stroyeva.  With Galina Ulanova, Ivan Kozlovsky, Maksim Mikhaylov, Aleksandr Pirogov. The story of the Bolshoi Theatre in Moscow and extracts from various performances.

Directed by Ford Beebe.  With Johnny Sheffield, Donna Martell, John Kellogg, Myron Healey. Elephant poachers Joe Collins and Bob Warren plan to steal a load of ivory which the natives want to give to the missionary, Miss Banks, but Bomba the Jungle Boy calls on friendly elephants to trample them to death.
Directed by Fred F. Sears.  With Charles Starrett, Fred F. Sears, Luther Crockett, Myron Healey. A man's pursuit of some wanted criminals is hindered by the interference of a crooked judge.

Directed by Friz Freleng.  With Mel Blanc, Stan Freberg. Two polite twin gophers are in their underground home, playing gin, when a dog buries his bone right on top of them. They try to negotiate with the dog so that he will bury the bone somewhere else. But the dog refuses to be cooperative and chases the gophers straight into a gas main, which the gophers seal from the outside.

Directed by Maurice Labro.  With Fernandel, Andrex, Gaby André, André Roanne. Victor Boniface's life is not exactly a rest cure. Just imagine : Victor is both a store detective and a - shoplifter (only when he walks in his sleep, mind you). And falling in love while sleepwalking is no bed of roses either, as the good-natured man simply forgets everything after waking up.
Directed by William Beaudine.  With Leo Gorcey, Huntz Hall, Donald MacBride, Virginia Hewitt. In order to trap some spies, the Bowery Boys join the Army.

Directed by Alfred Rode.  With Claudine Dupuis, Alfred Rode, Pierre-Louis, Saint-Granier. A couple of dancers performs in a night club. The man is jealous of Gina, his partner,and keeps making scenes to her, going as far as bullying her on the stage during their act. A man gets killed. The dancer is suspected for being jealous of all the other men. Another potential culprit could the father of Gina since he overprotected his daughter. The real culprit will be unmasked after the police...

Directed by Robert Rossen.  With Mel Ferrer, Miroslava, Anthony Quinn, Eugene Iglesias. In 1950s Mexico, a famous bullfighter loses his nerve after he's injured and witnesses the death of another matador in the ring.

Directed by Curt Siodmak.  With Barbara Payton, Lon Chaney Jr., Raymond Burr, Tom Conway. The owner of a plantation in the jungle marries a beautiful woman. Shortly afterward, he is plagued by a strange voodoo curse which transforms him into a gorilla.

Directed by Mark Robson.  With Arthur Kennedy, Peggy Dow, Julie Adams, James Edwards. After he gets blinded by a German sniper's bullet in 1943, Sergeant Larry Nevins begins the long and painful road to recovery.

Directed by Anthony Asquith.  With Michael Redgrave, Jean Kent, Nigel Patrick, Wilfrid Hyde-White. Forced to retire from an English public school, an unpopular professor must confront his failure as a teacher and husband.

Directed by Budd Boetticher.  With Robert Stack, Joy Page, Gilbert Roland, Virginia Grey. Hoping to impress a beautiful senorita, an American visiting Mexico trains with a famous Mexican bullfighter and becomes a competing bullfighter himself.
Directed by Chuck Jones.  With Mel Blanc, John T. Smith. This adventure takes Bugs into the world of professional wrestling.

Directed by Arne Mattsson.  With Alf Kjellin, Ulf Palme, Edvin Adolphson, Bengt Eklund. After a longer stay at the hospital, the young Martin comes to Gothenburg and notice that his fiancee Sonja has met another man.
Directed by Antonio Momplet.  With Imperio Argentina, Edmundo Barbero, Carlos Benso, Ricardo Castro Ríos.
Directed by Lloyd Bacon.  With Betty Grable, Dan Dailey, Danny Thomas, Dale Robertson. A G.I. in occupied Japan tries to re-woo his old love, who's putting on a show for the troops.

Directed by Melvin Frank, Norman Panama.  With Fred MacMurray, Dorothy McGuire, Howard Keel, Jesse White. Two marketing professionals hire a lookalike of classic western actor Smoky Callaway to impersonate the actor and make new films, but things go awry when the real Callaway, thought long missing, returns.

Directed by Victor Saville.  With Walter Pidgeon, Margaret Leighton, Robert Beatty, David Tomlinson. With a ruthless gang terrorizing London, Scotland Yard calls Hugh "Bulldog" Drummond out of retirement. With the help of detective Helen Smith, Drummond infiltrates the gang under an assumed name. He and Smith become trusted gang-members until the gang's overlord discovers their true identities, and they are taken as prisoners.

Directed by Giorgio Pastina.  With Elsa Merlini, Gino Cervi, Giulietta Masina, Alberto Sordi. Maria is a housmaid and she is being engaged to Berto for fifteen years. Berto has not a lasting job so he is waiting for the death of his uncle Matteo to come into an inheritance. In the meantime Maria goes on with her work, first in the house of an unfaithful wife; then for an actor and his wife on the verge of leaving each other and last for Raffaele who wants to marry her. At last uncle ...

Directed by Luis Escobar.  With María de los Ángeles Morales, Carlos Agostí, Fernando Aguirre, Mariano Alcón. When María marries she abandons her singing career. But when his husband is in financial difficulties she will sing again, soon becoming worldwide famous.
Directed by Friz Freleng.  With Mel Blanc, Marian Richman. Sylvester has only canned food available while his people are away. A pesky mouse torments him with the only can opener.

Directed by Lewis D. Collins.  With Whip Wilson, Fuzzy Knight, Jim Bannon, Phyllis Coates. Sam Wellman (I. Stanford Jolley), Lou Banks (Riley Hill) and Jack Marlin (Marshall Reed) have stolen horses from ranchers and have them corralled in Baxter Canyon, hoping to sell them at inflated prices to the Army with forged bill of sales. Whip Wilson (Whip Wilson) arrives in town in time to separate homesteader Texas Milburn (Fuzzy Knight) and gambler Hemingway (Bill Kennedy) from a gunfight ...
Directed by Raoul Walsh.  With Gregory Peck, Virginia Mayo, Robert Beatty, Moultrie Kelsall. During the Napoleonic wars, a British Navy Captain has adventures in Central American waters.

primaryTitle: Captain Video, Master of the Stratosphere

desc: Directed by Spencer Gordon Bennet, Wallace Grissell.  With Judd Holdren, Larry Stewart, George Eldredge, Gene Roth. Space hero Captain Video battles the evil Vultura on the planet Atoma.
Directed by Tex Avery.  With June Foray. A series of demonstrations of the kind of motoring accessories we'll all take for granted in the future...

Directed by Jean Yarbrough.  With Virginia Welles, Robert Clarke, Robert Karnes, Tony Roux. Linda Mason, secretary to advertising executive Horace Fairchild III, has theatrical aspirations, and unknown to her boss, she enters a radio talent contest. The contest is the brainchild of Larry Sawyer, press agent for Horace's company, but Horace takes undeserving credit for its success. Horace is in love with Linda as is Larry. The latter is opening a nightclub in partnership with Pedro ...

Directed by Joseph Barbera, William Hanna. Tom heads for a big city penthouse to become acquainted with a rich pretty female cat that lives there. He brings her Jerry as a gift and does some humiliating things to Jerry. Jerry, in turn, attracts the attention of another cat who also becomes interested in the female cat. It eventually turns into a fight between Tom and the other cat for the lady's hand but Jerry is the one who gets her in ...
Directed by Francis Searle.  With Brian Reece, Joy Shelton, Christine Norden, Leslie Bradley. PC 49 grapples with a beautiful artist's model in a case involving the murder of a millionaire.
Directed by Joseph Barbera, William Hanna. Tom's getting ready to settle into the hammock, but Jerry has beat him to it and the battle begins.
Directed by Arturo Ruiz Castillo.  With Maruchi Fresno, Rafael Luis Calvo, Mary Lamar, Carlo Tamberlani.

Directed by Kurt Neumann.  With Joel McCrea, Dean Stockwell, Chill Wills, Leon Ames. A cowboy finds the spoiled son of a railroad magnate lost in the deserted hills and teaches him survival skills and hard work values.

Directed by Tay Garnett.  With Loretta Young, Barry Sullivan, Bruce Cowling, Margalo Gillmore. An invalid husband wrongly believes his wife and doctor are conspiring to kill him and outlines that suspicion in a letter, which causes a serious concern when he ends up dying anyway.

Directed by Lesley Selander.  With Rod Cameron, Audrey Long, Jim Davis, James Millican. After 3 Gatling Guns are stolen from a Montana army arsenal, a Cavalry scout is dispatched there to retrieve them before the thieves can sell them to the Indians.

Directed by William Castle.  With Macdonald Carey, Alexis Smith, Edgar Buchanan, Victor Jory. Released after serving 15 years in prison for train robbery Pete Carver being the only survivor of the gang goes looking for the loot in the caves where it was hidden.
Directed by Mariano Pombo, Domingo Viladomat.  With Venancio Marcos, Patricia Morán, Gustavo Rojo, José Sepúlveda.

Directed by Will Jason.  With Richard Grayson, Margaret Field, Marta Mitrovich, Harold J. Kennedy. Dell and Tom Dawson is a young married couple beset with woe. They lose their baby and have extreme difficulty adopting another. Both end up accused of stealing a baby. Dell and Tom are saved from prison at the finale, but no such reprieve is given the couple's best friend Evie Carpenter, whose own travails drive her to suicide.
Directed by Pierre Blondy.  With Louis de Funès. Even back in 1951,boys knew more about cars than their dads .

Directed by Chuck Jones.  With Mel Blanc, Stan Freberg. After invading a cheese factory, mice Hubie and Bertie have finally had their fill of cheese and figure there's nothing more left to live for. They plan to end it all by surrendering to Claude Cat, who becomes decidedly suspicious.

Directed by John Reinhardt.  With Dan Duryea, Mary Anderson, Gordon Gebert, Ross Elliott. A poor father makes monumental efforts to get money to keep his phone installed, so he can get word on his critically injured little daughter.

Directed by Jack Hannah.  With Dessie Flynn, Florence Gill, Mary Lawrence, James MacDonald. Chip 'n' Dale are gathering nuts; the nuts fall into the chicken pen. When Dale is playing around with some eggs, one hatches. The chick leaves, and Dale has to pretend to be a chick to avoid the wrath of the rooster.

Directed by Ray Nazarro.  With Jon Hall, Lisa Ferraday, Ron Randell, Douglas Kennedy. In 'The Green Dragon' gambling club, operated by Hu Chang (Ernest Borgnine), a merchant marine, McMillen (Jon Hall), bets the last of his money. He is cheated out of his winnings. He gets a job on the Sally Ann as the engineer. On board is Paul Lowell (Ron Randell) who killed Tamara's (Lisa Ferraday) uncle for some valuable jade. Tamara and her thugs catch up to the Sally Ann and recovers her ...

Directed by Chuck Jones.  With Mel Blanc, Bea Benaderet, Stan Freberg, John T. Smith. A perpetually-hungry dog has a great scheme going: planting a cat in different houses and bullying it out the food its "owners" give it. But he keeps getting hungrier and hungrier, and the cat keeps forgetting the gravy.

Directed by Manuel Mur Oti.  With Susana Canales, Fernando Rey, Luis Prendes, Teresa Casal. A woman who works as employee in a fashion store has to care for her ill mother. At the same time she falls in love with a bohemian man.

Directed by Jacques Tourneur.  With Ray Milland, Patricia Roc, Marius Goring, Hugh Sinclair. In the 1950s, an American comes to Britain to investigate the murky circumstances of his brother's death that occurred during a WW2 commando raid in Nazi-occupied France.

Directed by Pietro Germi.  With Gina Lollobrigida, Renato Baldini, Cosetta Greco, Paul Muller. Four criminals commit a robbery at a soccer stadium, and then split up to try to hide separately from the police.

Directed by Guido Salvini.  With Doris Duranti, Jacques Sernas, Edda Albertini, Carlo D'Angelo. An Italian Air Force officer is pursued and captured by the Allied police and is charged with the bombing of a hospital ship. Through the efforts of his sweetheart, a witness is found who proves the bombing was not intentional but the result of being hit by enemy fire. A four-way romantic involvement is also part of the mix that includes an Allied officer and Viennse beauty Lida. The latter was ...

Directed by William Keighley.  With Ray Milland, Gene Tierney, Fay Bainter, Howard St. John. Gene Tierney and Ray Milland play the Sheridans, a married couple unable to have a biological child. They visit an adoption agency to make inquiries and start the ball rolling. Then, they learn of a child abandoned at a local police station. Fedor falls in love with her without betraying his identity.
